intro: Habranthus pulcher, commonly known as the beautiful habitant, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shady, moist environments and has strap-like, evergreen leaves. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer months.
